head.citation-title: 2014 IEEE Benjamin Franklin Symposium on Microwave and Antenna Subsystems for Radar, Telecommunication, and Biomedical Applications, BenMAS 2016
head.abstracts: The proceedings contain 37 papers. The topics discussed include: recent advances in wall characterization and fast target imaging in through-the-wall radar; applying beamformer time modulation to blank sidelobes; compact monostatic/bistatic UWB radar for wall characterization; a novel metamaterial resonator based signal sources for applications in current and later generation radio communication systems; minimum output power anti-jam with fully augmentbale arrays in GPS; improved breakdown threshold (multipaction and ionic) in lumped element filters; antenna array signal processing for quaternion-valued wireless communication; and design and implementation of wideband microwave amplifiers based on normalized gain function.
